buyers.title: Take stock of your finances
buyers.text: Before you start house-hunting, it’s a good idea to work out how much your monthly mortgage payments will likely cost and whether you can afford it.

buyers.title: Consult an estate agent
buyers.text: We know how stressful house-hunting can be, that’s why we’re here to take the hassle out of the process. Remember, our services are all FREE with no obligation on your part.

buyers.title: View the property
buyers.text: It’s important to see the property you like and get a feel for it in person. This will give you a better idea of its potential, which you can't always get from a screen.

buyers.title: Make the right offer
buyers.text: Found a property that makes you tick? Fantastic. Now it’s time to make an offer – the right offer! – and we shall keep our fingers crossed for you.

buyers.title: Hire a surveyor and conveyancer
buyers.text: The surveyor will value the property and check for potential problems which might affect its final cost, whilst the conveyancer will handle the legal side of the sale.

buyers.title: Finalise everything
buyers.text: When the survey is complete, if you want to renegotiate the price of your new home, this is the time to instruct us to do so on your behalf before the deal is sealed.

buyers.title: Exchange contracts
buyers.text: Once the terms are agreed and approved by all parties, you should receive the contract to sign and commit to the sale. Then, there’s just one thing left to do…

buyers.title: Completion and move in
buyers.text: On completion day, money will be transferred to the seller and you will receive the keys to your new home. It’s time to call that removal company – congratulations!

sellers.title: Get the price right
sellers.text: We will give you an accurate and up-to-date valuation of your property, based on data including current market values and recent sales in your area.

sellers.title: Prepare marketing materials
sellers.text: We will take professional photos of your property, create floor plans, video tours and even capture drone footage if appropriate, to give your property the best chance of standing out in the market.

sellers.title: List your property
sellers.text: We will advertise your property on leading property portals, social media and our website, as well as contact our database of registered buyers.

sellers.title: Arrange viewings
sellers.text: One of our team members will be on hand to carry out accompanied viewings at a time and day that works for you and your prospective buyers.

sellers.title: Respond to feedback
sellers.text: We aim to provide you with feedback within 24 hours after each viewing and evaluate the comments to come up with a plan of action if necessary.

sellers.title: Accept an offer
sellers.text: You’ve received an offer – brilliant! We will negotiate the best price for your property on your behalf, but the final decision is yours to make.

sellers.title: Progress your sale
sellers.text: A dedicated team member will guide you through the sales progression and do their best to reduce delays and avoid problems where possible.

sellers.title: Completion day
sellers.text: Once the property sales contracts are exchanged via your solicitors and the final funds are transferred, it’s time to hand over the keys. Congratulations!

landlords.title: Arrange an appraisal visit
landlords.text: During the appraisal visit, we will have a tour around your property then provide an accurate rental value and make recommendations where we see fit.

landlords.title: Prepare your property
landlords.text: Once we’re happy that all legalities are in place, we will prepare marketing materials to create a listing on leading property portals Rightmove and Zoopla, social media and our own website.

landlords.title: Find the right tenant
landlords.text: We will invite suitable tenants for viewings. All subsequent offers and relevant information will be presented to you in writing, all you have to do is choose your best fit.

landlords.title: Referencing and deposits
landlords.text: We will take a holding deposit from your tenant, send them more information and initiate a reference check in partnership with a professional company.

landlords.title: Contracts, payments and move-in
landlords.text: When all referencing checks out, you and your tenant will sign the tenancy agreement, and you tenant will pay the first month’s rent and balance of deposit before moving in.

landlords.title: Property management
landlords.text: Throughout the tenancy, our network of trusted contractors will carry out regular inspections and promptly respond to maintenance requests if needed.

landlords.title: Check-out and deposit settlement
landlords.text: When the time comes for your tenant to move out, we will pay them a visit to ensure the property is returned in its original condition; and the search for the next tenant begins.

tenants.title: Tell us what you want
tenants.text: The more we know about your criteria for your rental property, the better equipped we will be at finding you an ideal home.

tenants.title: View the property
tenants.text: When we identify a potential home for you, you’ll have the opportunity to view it and explore the surroundings for yourself.

tenants.title: Put a holding deposit down
tenants.text: Found your perfect match? The rental market moves fast so if you see the perfect property, you must act quickly to secure it.

tenants.title: Perform background checks
tenants.text: This process will include a credit search, employment check, previous landlord reference and right to rent check (if applicable).

tenants.title: Seal the deal
tenants.text: When you pass the background checks, it’s time for you and your landlord to put pen to paper and sign the tenancy agreement.

tenants.title: Get ready to move in
tenants.text: Get excited because it’s move-in day! But before you do, move-in money must be paid and cleared, then you can move in.
